text: Thank you Chad.  I will check it out!

Hello. I'm new in HubSpot. I've created a module for testing purpose with just a color field inside -> I've inserted this module in a template -> I've created a page from this template. When I visualize this page in editor, I cannot change the color. In the design manager, the option "Prevent modifications in content editors" is on. That's why I cannot change color in the page. But I cannot change this option: the switch/toogle element to change this option cannot be clicked. How can I make this element clickable?

How to create this type of code in Drag and Drop Module?
Basically I have to create design like the second image & for that I need a Span-tag inside a div block so that I can make stripes pattern design.
Hey <@UM4EYDDAS> would you mind sending me over a direct message with the link to the module that you're working on so that I can take a closer look?

Hello Sylvain, I was also stuck with same problem.
You Just have to add a simple code ".color" at last  where you had pasted the snippet value.
For better understanding go through my attached file.
Thanks <@ULQGK1Y2D> But my code has the color property.
Please send the screenshot of your code  wherever you are facing problem.
I understand with <@U26AKMZ19> It was a global module and we cannot modify in editor a global module... Thanks  Farrooque.

Hey all, I’m super new to HubSpot, but my company has asked me to recreate a landing page I built into HubSpot as a template for one of our clients. I’m trying to build a module, have linked my full stylesheet, and it seems to take until I add a field in. When I do that, the styles disappear entirely for that element. Any clues? I’m sure it’s something simple since I’ve never done this before, but I’m not coming up with much on Google. Thanks!
Hey Alyssa :wave: would you be able to send over some screenshots or shoot me over a direct message with the link to the module that you're working on so that I can take a look?

Hey <@ULQGK1Y2D> would you be able to add that HTML inside of a new custom module (<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/create-and-edit-modules>)? Or are you running into issues when doing that?
